security: Revealing that Abram Chayes had security approval for liaison contact with the Chief of the Covert Action Staff and could discuss DPD 5412/2 matters on a need-to-know basis, could compromise ongoing operations. Quoting directly, "The request for CHAYES' clearance was a 'blanket' request to permit discussion with him of DPD 5412/2 matters on a need-to-know basis."
summary: This file discusses individuals involved in Lee Harvey Oswald's return to the United States from the Soviet Union, including Abram Chayes and Samuel Weis, along with potential security concerns and associations.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET file, dated January 29, 1964, concerns the case of Lee Harvey Oswald and focuses on Abram Chayes, a Legal Officer of the State Department, and Samuel Weis, Counsel of the American Embassy in Moscow, for their roles related to Oswald's return from the Soviet Union in 1962. It details Chayes' security clearance for liaison contact with the Covert Action Staff and mentions a White House name check request on his wife. The file also explores Samuel Weis's background, including his past consideration for CIA employment, his work on the defection case of Bruce Frederick Davis (similar to Oswald's), and his association with William Orville Marell, who was previously security disapproved.
title: THE LEE HARVEY OSWALD CASE
